quiz.text: Which is the first Indian Commercial Bank that was fully owned and managed by Indians ?
options: Central Bank of India
State Bank of India
Allahabad Bank
Canara Bank
Union Bank

quiz.text: Which of the following banks started as a private shareholders bank, mostly by European shareholders ?
options: Bank of India
Bank of Baroda
Dena Bank
Imperial Bank of India
South Indian Bank

quiz.text: Which of the following was the first Indian bank that started solely with Indian Capital?
options: Punjab National Bank
Andhra Bank
Indian Overseas Bank
Syndicate Bank
None of these

quiz.text: In which of the following cities, the head office of Corporation Bank is situated ?
options: Mumbai
Bengaluru
Mangalore
Kolkata
Manipal

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are true about NABARD ?
options: It is a development bank in the sector of Regional Rural Banks in India.
It provides and regulates credits in the rural area.
It gives assistance for the promotion and development of rural sectors, mainly agriculture.
It finances rural crafts.
All of these.

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are true about Co-operative Banks in India ?
options: It has a three-tire set-up.
State Co-operative Banks does not have access to RBI
It is an urban oriented Bank
It functions on sound business principles.
None of these.

quiz.text: Fiscal policy is related with which of the following ?
options: Public Revenue and Expenditure
Public Revenue only
Import and Export
Issue of Currency
None of these

quiz.text: What is the function of IRDA ?
options: Plan for Financial Inclusion
Regulate insurance business in India
Hiring & Purchasing assets
Provide relief packages to the Farmers
None of these

quiz.text: Which of the following organizations decides Repo Rate ?
options: SEBI
IMF
AMFI
SBI
RBI

quiz.text: Which of the following is/are true about IMF?
options: It's headquarters is situated at Washington, DC.
It works to foster economic stability and global growth by providing policy, advice and financing to members.
It negotiates conditions on lending and loans under their policy.
It oversees the fixed exchange rate arrangements between countries.
All of these

quiz.text: In which year, Vijaya Bank was nationalized?
options: 1969
1950
1959
1980
2000

quiz.text: Who among the following is the chief of IMF?
options: Robert Zoelick
Christine Lagarde
Kristalina Georgieva
Takehiko Nakao
None of these

quiz.text: Which of the following is a bank-related term?
options: Writ
Blue Book
Blockade
Liquid
Real time Gross Settlement

quiz.text: Which of the following is not a Bank?
options: HSBC
BNP Paribas
Barclays
Lufthansa
All are banks

quiz.text: Which of the following is the main aim of financial inclusion ?
options: to maintain a certain quantity of liquid assets with themselves at any point of time of their total time and demand liabilities.
to control money supply in the economy
to provide basic banking services to all sections of society in urban areas or rural areas at affordable cost
Only A and B
None of these

quiz.text: Which of the following is not a Foreign bank?
options: Citi Bank
HSBC
BNP Paribas
Oriental Bank of Commerce
Taib Bank

quiz.text: What is known as the certain percentage of bank deposits which banks are required to keep with RBI in the form of reserves or balances ?
options: Statutory liquidity ratio
Repo Rate
Reverse Repo Rate
Cash Reserve Ratio
None of these

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are true about Marginal Standing Facility?
options: Banks can avail funds on overnight basis below the stipulated SLR up to two per cent of their respective Net Demand
Banks can avail funds from the RBI on overnight basis against their excess SLR holdings
Bank can meet the liquidity requirements of mutual funds
Bank can get loans from RBI for their emergency needs
All of these

quiz.text: The rate, at which RBI lends money to commercial banks against securities when commercial banks have less funds for Short Term, is/are known as which of the following ?
options: Statutory Liquidity Ratio
Repurchase Rate
Policy Rate
Only A and B
Repo Rate

quiz.text: What is the main tool to control money supply in case of banking?
options: Bank Rate
Repo Rate
Reverse Repo Rate
LTV Ratio
None of these

quiz.text: Which of the following is the first bank of India ?
options: Allahabad Bank
State Bank of India
Punjab National Bank
Bank of Hindustan
None of these

quiz.text: Which one of the following is the largest Foreign Bank in India?
options: HSBC
Standard Chartered Bank
Taib Bank
Barclays Bank
None of these

quiz.text: Which of the following is the First Regional Rural Bank in India ?
options: Kashi Gomti Samyut Gramin Bank
Andhra Pradesh GrameenaVikas Bank
Prathama Bank
Bharatiya Mahila Bank
None of these

quiz.text: Which of the following is not an initiative taken by RBI and GOI towards financial inclusion?
options: Swabhimaan Scheme
Easy KYC norms
Granting new bank licenses
Banking correspondent model
Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is/are not true about Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana?
options: Every Indian family enrolled in a bank to open zero balance account
The account can be opened by can be open by giving only one document either proof of address and proof of identity
It provides various different profit to account holder like insurance cover, overdraft facility ,Atm card etc.
The main aim is to open one bank account for every adult person in every family
All are true
